messages.content: You are an expert TECHNICAL SALES ASSISTANT for Teklab. ALWAYS respond in the EXACT SAME LANGUAGE as the user's question. Provide expert technical consultation on Teklab products.

SEMANTIC CONCEPT: TK3+ 130bar CO2 Transcritical/Subcritical System Controller Overview

ğŸ¯ CUSTOMER QUESTION: "What is TK3+ 130bar? When to use it? Compatible with CO2 systems? Specifications?"

**TK3+ 130bar - HIGH-PRESSURE CO2 OIL LEVEL CONTROLLER**

---

## PRODUCT OVERVIEW

**TK3+ 130bar** is the **highest pressure** version in the TK3+ family:

â€¢ **Maximum pressure rating**: **130 bar** (13 MPa / 1885 psi)
â€¢ **PRIMARY application**: **CO2 refrigeration systems** (R744)
â€¢ **Transcritical CO2**: High-side pressure 80-120 bar (normal operation)
â€¢ **Subcritical CO2**: Cascade systems, low-temperature refrigeration
â€¢ **Test pressure**: 195 bar (1.5Ã— safety factor)
â€¢ **Burst pressure**: >300 bar (design safety)

**Market Position:**
âœ… **HIGHEST pressure** optical oil level sensor available
âœ… **CO2-specific** design (POE oil + high pressure)
âœ… **Supermarket refrigeration** (centralized racks, booster systems)
âœ… **Natural refrigerant** compliance (F-Gas regulation, low GWP)

---

## WHY TK3+ 130bar vs. 46bar/80bar?

**Pressure Comparison:**

| **Refrigerant** | **Evap Pressure** | **Cond Pressure** | **TK3+ Model** |
|-----------------|-------------------|-------------------|----------------|
| R134a | 2-6 bar | 10-14 bar | **46bar** âœ… |
| R404A | 4-12 bar | 16-20 bar | **46bar** âœ… |
| R407C | 4-11 bar | 14-18 bar | **46bar** âœ… |
| R410A | 10-16 bar | 26-32 bar | **80bar** âœ… |
| **CO2 subcritical** | 10-30 bar | 50-70 bar | **130bar** âœ… |
| **CO2 transcritical** | 30-40 bar | **80-120 bar** | **130bar** âœ… |

**Decision Rule:**
â€¢ System pressure â‰¤ 45 bar â†’ TK3+ **46bar**
â€¢ System pressure 46-75 bar â†’ TK3+ **80bar**
â€¢ System pressure >75 bar OR CO2 â†’ TK3+ **130bar** âœ…

---

## TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS

**Pressure:**
â€¢ **Maximum operating**: 130 bar (13 MPa / 1885 psi)
â€¢ **Proof pressure** (test): 195 bar (1.5Ã— safety)
â€¢ **Burst pressure**: >300 bar (2.3Ã— safety)
â€¢ **Typical CO2 application**: 80-120 bar (transcritical high side)
â€¢ **Safety margin**: 10-50 bar (depending on climate)

**Temperature:**
â€¢ **Operating range**: -40Â°C to +125Â°C
â€¢ **Storage**: -50Â°C to +150Â°C
â€¢ **CO2 gas cooler**: Up to 40Â°C (summer operation)
â€¢ **CO2 evaporator**: -35Â°C to -10Â°C (frozen food)

**Electrical:**
â€¢ **Power supply**: 24V DC Â±10% (21.6V to 26.4V)
â€¢ **Current consumption**: 150 mA max (typical 100 mA)
â€¢ **Relay output**: 5A @ 250V AC (SPDT - COM, NO, NC)
â€¢ **Analog output**: 4-20 mA (Â±0.5 mA accuracy, 500 Î© max load)
â€¢ **Programmable timer**: 0-10 seconds (default 3s)

**Sensor Technology:**
â€¢ **Detection principle**: Electro-optic infrared (IR)
â€¢ **Sensor tip**: Sapphire prism (hardness 9 Mohs - extremely durable)
â€¢ **Response time**: <100 ms (oil presence/absence)
â€¢ **Accuracy**: Â±2 mm (oil level detection)
â€¢ **Oil compatibility**: POE (primary for CO2), Mineral, PAG, AB (alkylbenzene)

**Mechanical:**
â€¢ **Mounting**: Direct flange (dual pitch: 40 mm + 38 mm)
â€¢ **Flange material**: Brass CW617N (dezincification resistant)
â€¢ **Torque**: 15-20 Nm (M6 bolts)
â€¢ **Housing**: Aluminum alloy (anodized, corrosion resistant)
â€¢ **IP rating**: IP65 (dust tight, water jet protected)
â€¢ **Weight**: 450 g
â€¢ **Cable entry**: M16 cable gland

**Connections:**
â€¢ **Wiring**: 7-pin screw terminals
  - Pin 1-2: Power (24V DC)
  - Pin 3-4-5: Relay (COM, NO, NC)
  - Pin 6-7: 4-20 mA analog output
â€¢ **Cable**: Shielded 7Ã—0.75 mmÂ² STP (max 50 m)

---

## CO2 REFRIGERANT COMPATIBILITY

**R744 (CO2) - PRIMARY APPLICATION**

**Transcritical CO2 Systems:**
â€¢ **High side** (gas cooler): 80-120 bar (summer 35-40Â°C ambient)
â€¢ **Low side** (evaporator): 30-40 bar (-10Â°C to -35Â°C)
â€¢ **Pressure ratio**: 2.5-3.5:1
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar rating**: âœ… Covers full range + safety margin

**Subcritical CO2 Systems:**
â€¢ **High side** (condenser): 50-70 bar (-10Â°C to -5Â°C)
â€¢ **Low side** (evaporator): 10-30 bar (-35Â°C to -20Â°C)
â€¢ **Cascade**: CO2 low-stage, R404A/R134a high-stage
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: âœ… Suitable for subcritical (60 bar margin)

**CO2 Booster Systems** (Supermarket):
â€¢ **MT (Medium Temp)**: Evaporator -8Â°C, 30 bar
â€¢ **LT (Low Temp)**: Evaporator -35Â°C, 10 bar
â€¢ **Compressor rack**: MT + LT compressors, common oil sump
â€¢ **Flash gas bypass**: Intermediate pressure 45-55 bar
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: Monitors **oil separator** (high-side 80-120 bar)

---

## OIL COMPATIBILITY (CO2 SYSTEMS)

**POE (Polyolester) - MANDATORY for CO2**

**Why POE Required:**
â€¢ CO2 is **non-polar** (does NOT dissolve in mineral oil)
â€¢ **Mineral oil** returns to compressor poorly (oil logging in evaporator)
â€¢ **POE oil** is polar (miscible with CO2 at all temperatures)
â€¢ **Oil return**: CO2 velocity carries POE back to compressor

**POE Oil Characteristics:**
â€¢ Viscosity: ISO 32, 46, 68 (depending on compressor type)
â€¢ Color: Clear to pale yellow (excellent for optical detection)
â€¢ Hygroscopic: Absorbs moisture (requires dry system, filter driers)
â€¢ **TK3+ detection**: âœ… Excellent (clear oil, high refractive index)

**Other Oils (Rare in CO2):**
â€¢ **PAG** (Polyalkylene Glycol): Used in some automotive CO2 AC (R744)
  - TK3+ detection: âœ… Good (clear oil)
â€¢ **Mineral oil**: âŒ NOT compatible with CO2 (poor miscibility)
  - Only in cascade systems (R404A side, not CO2 side)

---

## KEY APPLICATIONS

### **1. Supermarket Refrigeration (Booster Racks)**

**System Configuration:**
â€¢ **MT compressors** (3-6 units): Medium temp cases (+2Â°C dairy, meat)
â€¢ **LT compressors** (2-4 units): Low temp freezers (-18Â°C to -25Â°C)
â€¢ **Oil separator** (high side): Extracts oil from hot gas (80-120 bar)
â€¢ **Oil reservoir**: Collects oil, returns to compressors via oil management

**TK3+ 130bar Location:**
â€¢ **Oil separator** (primary): Monitors total system oil
â€¢ **Compressor rack** (optional): Individual compressor oil sumps
â€¢ **Flash gas receiver** (advanced): Intermediate pressure oil collection

**Advantages:**
âœ… **Single sensor** monitors entire rack (MT + LT)
âœ… **High-pressure capability** (80-120 bar gas cooler pressure)
âœ… **Programmable timer** (compensates for oil foam in CO2 systems)
âœ… **Dual output** (relay for alarm + 4-20mA for SCADA trending)

---

### **2. CO2 Transcritical Systems (Commercial)**

**Applications:**
â€¢ Convenience stores, restaurants, cafes
â€¢ Small supermarkets (<500 mÂ²)
â€¢ Cold storage warehouses

**System:**
â€¢ **1-2 compressors** (reciprocating or scroll)
â€¢ **Gas cooler** (replaces condenser): 80-120 bar, 25-40Â°C
â€¢ **Evaporator**: -10Â°C to -35Â°C, 30-40 bar
â€¢ **Expansion valve**: High-pressure differential (50-90 bar drop)

**TK3+ 130bar:**
â€¢ Monitors compressor oil sump (30-40 bar low side pressure)
â€¢ **Critical**: CO2 systems have rapid oil circulation (high velocity)
â€¢ **Timer setting**: 5-7 seconds (compensates for turbulent oil in sump)

---

### **3. Cascade CO2 Systems**

**Configuration:**
â€¢ **Low stage** (CO2): Evaporator -35Â°C to -55Â°C (ultra-low temp)
â€¢ **High stage** (R404A/R134a): Condenser +30Â°C to +40Â°C
â€¢ **Cascade condenser**: CO2 condenses at -10Â°C to -5Â°C (50-70 bar)

**TK3+ 130bar Use:**
â€¢ **CO2 compressor** (low stage): Monitor oil sump (50-70 bar)
â€¢ **Oil separator**: CO2 side (high-side 50-70 bar)
â€¢ **TK3+ 46bar/80bar**: R404A compressor (high stage)

**Why 130bar for Subcritical CO2:**
â€¢ Subcritical CO2: 50-70 bar (vs. transcritical 80-120 bar)
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: âœ… Still recommended (60 bar safety margin)
â€¢ **TK3+ 80bar**: âš ï¸ Marginal (10 bar margin only)

---

### **4. Industrial CO2 Refrigeration**

**Applications:**
â€¢ Food processing plants
â€¢ Cold storage (fruit, vegetables, meat)
â€¢ Ice rinks (ice resurfacing, brine cooling)
â€¢ Breweries (fermentation cooling)

**System Size:**
â€¢ 50-500 kW refrigeration capacity
â€¢ 5-20 compressors (centralized rack)
â€¢ Oil management system (separator, reservoir, pumps)

**TK3+ 130bar:**
â€¢ **Oil separator** (main): 80-120 bar (transcritical) or 50-70 bar (subcritical)
â€¢ **Oil reservoir**: Intermediate pressure (45-55 bar)
â€¢ **Compressor oil sumps**: Low-side pressure (30-40 bar)
â€¢ **Quantity**: 1-3 sensors (depending on system complexity)

---

## COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGES

**vs. TK3+ 80bar:**
âœ… **62% higher pressure** (130 bar vs. 80 bar)
âœ… **CO2 transcritical** capable (80-120 bar gas cooler)
âœ… **Future-proof** (highest natural refrigerant pressure)
âœ… **Safety margin** for extreme climates (>40Â°C ambient)

**vs. Mechanical Float Switches:**
âœ… **Higher pressure rating** (floats typically â‰¤60 bar)
âœ… **No moving parts** (floats wear, stick, corrode)
âœ… **No recalibration** (floats drift over time)
âœ… **Vibration resistant** (floats give false alarms)

**vs. Capacitive Oil Level Sensors:**
âœ… **Oil type independent** (capacitive needs calibration for POE vs. Mineral)
âœ… **No contamination sensitivity** (capacitive affected by moisture, particles)
âœ… **No geographic calibration** (capacitive affected by gravity variation)
âœ… **CO2 compatible** (capacitive struggles with high-pressure CO2 systems)

**vs. Competitor Optical Sensors:**
âœ… **130 bar rating** (highest in market - competitors â‰¤100 bar)
âœ… **Programmable timer** (0-10s vs. fixed 2-3s)
âœ… **Dual output** (relay + 4-20mA vs. relay only)
âœ… **Dual pitch flange** (40mm + 38mm vs. single pitch)
âœ… **IP65 rated** (competitors often IP54)

---

## INSTALLATION HIGHLIGHTS

**Mounting:**
â€¢ **Direct flange** mount (compressor oil sump, oil separator, oil reservoir)
â€¢ **Dual pitch**: 40 mm (standard) + 38 mm (Carrier, Frascold)
â€¢ **Adapters available**: For non-standard flanges (Danfoss, NPT threads)
â€¢ **Orientation**: Vertical (sensor tip pointing straight down)
â€¢ **Torque**: 15-20 Nm (M6 bolts, cross pattern)

**Wiring:**
â€¢ **Power**: Pin 1-2 (24V DC, polarity marked)
â€¢ **Relay**: Pin 3 (COM), Pin 4 (NO), Pin 5 (NC)
  - Oil OK: NO contact OPEN
  - Oil LOW: NO contact CLOSED (alarm, shutdown compressor)
â€¢ **Analog**: Pin 6-7 (4-20 mA)
  - Oil OK: 20 mA
  - Oil LOW: 4 mA
  - Use: PLC trending, predictive maintenance

**Commissioning:**
1. Verify 24V DC power (21.6-26.4V)
2. Test LED: Green (oil OK), Red (oil LOW)
3. Test relay: Multimeter (contact resistance)
4. Test 4-20mA: Clamp meter or PLC analog input
5. Adjust timer: 3s (standard), 5-7s (CO2 booster - turbulent oil)
6. Pressure test: 10 bar nitrogen (leak check flange)
7. Run system: Verify detection during operation

---

## WHEN TO USE TK3+ 130bar vs. 46bar/80bar

**ALWAYS Use TK3+ 130bar:**
âœ… **CO2 refrigerant** (transcritical or subcritical)
âœ… **System pressure >75 bar** (any refrigerant)
âœ… **Supermarket booster racks** (CO2 MT/LT)
âœ… **Industrial CO2** (food processing, cold storage)
âœ… **Cascade systems** (CO2 low stage)

**CONSIDER TK3+ 130bar:**
âš ï¸ **CO2 subcritical** (50-70 bar - 130bar has 60 bar margin)
âš ï¸ **Extreme climates** (>40Â°C ambient - pressure spikes >100 bar)
âš ï¸ **Critical applications** (zero downtime - maximum safety margin)
âš ï¸ **Future refrigerant transition** (F-Gas phase-down â†’ CO2 adoption)

**TK3+ 130bar NOT Needed (Use 46bar/80bar):**
âŒ **HFC refrigerants** (R134a, R404A, R407C - max 20 bar)
âŒ **R410A** (max 32 bar - use TK3+ 80bar)
âŒ **Low-pressure systems** (<45 bar - TK3+ 46bar sufficient)

**TK3+ 130bar NOT Suitable:**
âŒ **Ammonia (R717)**: Corrosive to aluminum/brass
  â†’ Use **ATEX Metallic IR Sensor** (316L stainless steel)

---

## REGULATIONS & COMPLIANCE

**EU F-Gas Regulation (517/2014):**
â€¢ **Phase-down**: HFC quota reduction 79% by 2030
â€¢ **Ban**: HFC with GWP >2500 in new equipment (2020)
â€¢ **CO2 (R744)**: GWP = **1** (natural refrigerant)
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: âœ… Future-proof (CO2-compatible)

**EN 378 (Refrigeration Safety):**
â€¢ **CO2 classification**: A1 (low toxicity, non-flammable)
â€¢ **High-pressure equipment**: Pressure equipment directive (PED)
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: CE marked, PED compliant

**ASHRAE Safety Standard 15:**
â€¢ **CO2 safety**: Asphyxiation risk in enclosed spaces
â€¢ **Oil level monitoring**: Critical for compressor protection
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: Dual output (relay shutdown + analog monitoring)

**National Regulations:**
â€¢ **Japan**: F-Gas phase-down (CO2 adoption in supermarkets)
â€¢ **USA**: EPA SNAP program (CO2 approved for all applications)
â€¢ **Australia**: Ozone/SGG Act (CO2 incentives)

---

## RELATED PRODUCTS

**TK3+ Family:**
â€¢ **TK3+ 46bar**: Standard HFC refrigerants (R134a, R404A, R407C)
â€¢ **TK3+ 80bar**: R410A, high-ambient HFC systems
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: CO2 (R744) transcritical/subcritical âœ…

**TK4 MODBUS:**
â€¢ **TK4 MODBUS 130bar**: CO2 + RS485 MODBUS RTU connectivity
â€¢ **Use case**: SCADA integration, remote monitoring, multi-sensor networks

**LC Series** (Liquid Level Controllers):
â€¢ **LC-PS**: Relay output (liquid receivers, intercoolers)
â€¢ **LC-XP**: 4-20mA analog (precise level monitoring)
â€¢ **LC-XT**: Relay + analog + temperature (triple functionality)
â€¢ **Pressure rating**: 46 bar (not suitable for CO2 - use TK3+ 130bar)

**ATEX Sensors:**
â€¢ **ATEX Metallic IR**: For ammonia (R717), explosive atmospheres
â€¢ **Material**: 316L stainless steel (ammonia-resistant)
â€¢ **Pressure**: 25 bar (ammonia systems)

---

## SPECIFICATIONS SUMMARY

**Pressure**: 130 bar max (195 bar test, >300 bar burst)
**Temperature**: -40Â°C to +125Â°C
**Power**: 24V DC Â±10%, 150 mA max
**Relay**: 5A @ 250V AC SPDT
**Analog**: 4-20 mA Â±0.5 mA, 500 Î© load
**Timer**: 0-10 seconds programmable (default 3s)

**Cable**: 7-pin, M16 gland, shielded STP 7Ã—0.75 mmÂ², max 50m
**Refrigerants**: **CO2 (R744) PRIMARY**, also R404A/R407C/R134a/R410A (if >75 bar)
**Oils**: **POE (PRIMARY for CO2)**, Mineral, PAG, AB
**Certifications**: CE, RoHS, PED
**Lifespan**: 10-15 years
**Warranty**: 2 years (extendable to 5 years)

---

**EXPERT CONSULTATION:**

For CO2 system design, pressure calculations, or application-specific advice:

Provide:
â€¢ System type (transcritical/subcritical/cascade/booster)
â€¢ Compressor brand + model
â€¢ Gas cooler/condenser design pressure
â€¢ Ambient temperature range
â€¢ Supermarket layout (if applicable)

**TK3+ 130bar - CO2 Transcritical/Subcritical Oil Level Controller**

The highest-pressure optical oil level controller designed specifically for CO2 (R744) refrigeration systems, including transcritical, subcritical, and booster configurations.

---

## PRODUCT OVERVIEW

## CO2 REFRIGERANT COMPATIBILITY

**R744 (CO2) - PRIMARY APPLICATION**

**Transcritical CO2:**

â€¢ Evaporator (low side): 30-40 bar (-10Â°C to -35Â°C)

**Subcritical CO2:**

## OIL COMPATIBILITY (CO2)

**POE (Polyolester) - MANDATORY**

**Why POE for CO2:**
â€¢ CO2 non-polar (NOT soluble in mineral oil)

**POE Characteristics:**
â€¢ Viscosity: ISO 32, 46, 68
â€¢ Color: Clear to pale yellow (excellent optical detection)
â€¢ Hygroscopic: Absorbs moisture (needs dry system)

**Other Oils:**
â€¢ PAG: Automotive CO2 AC (TK3+ âœ… Good)

## KEY APPLICATIONS

### **1. Supermarket Refrigeration (Booster)**

**System:**

### **3. Cascade CO2 Systems**

**Configuration:**
â€¢ Low stage (CO2): -35Â°C to -55Â°C (ultra-low)

## COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGES

**vs. TK3+ 80bar:**
âœ… 62% higher pressure (130 vs. 80 bar)

**vs. Mechanical Floats:**

**vs. Competitor Optical:**

## INSTALLATION HIGHLIGHTS

**Mounting:**

**Wiring:**
â€¢ Power: Pin 1-2 (24V DC)
â€¢ Relay: Pin 3 (COM), 4 (NO), 5 (NC)
  - Oil OK: NO OPEN
  - Oil LOW: NO CLOSED (alarm, shutdown)
â€¢ Analog: Pin 6-7 (4-20 mA)
  - Oil OK: 20 mA
  - Oil LOW: 4 mA

**Commissioning:**
1. Verify 24V DC (21.6-26.4V)
2. Test LED: Green (OK), Red (LOW)
3. Test relay (multimeter)
4. Test 4-20mA (clamp meter/PLC)
5. Adjust timer: 3s (standard), 5-7s (CO2 booster)
6. Pressure test: 10 bar nitrogen (leak check)
7. Run system, verify detection

---

## WHEN TO USE 130bar vs. 46bar/80bar

**ALWAYS Use TK3+ 130bar:**
âœ… **CO2 refrigerant** (transcritical/subcritical)
âœ… System pressure >75 bar
âœ… Supermarket booster racks (CO2 MT/LT)
âœ… Industrial CO2 (food, cold storage)
âœ… Cascade systems (CO2 low stage)

**CONSIDER 130bar:**
âš ï¸ CO2 subcritical (50-70 bar - 60 bar margin)
âš ï¸ Extreme climates (>40Â°C - spikes >100 bar)
âš ï¸ Critical applications (zero downtime)
âš ï¸ Future refrigerant transition (F-Gas â†’ CO2)

**130bar NOT Needed:**
âŒ HFC (R134a, R404A, R407C - max 20 bar)
âŒ R410A (max 32 bar - use 80bar)
âŒ Low-pressure (<45 bar - 46bar OK)

**130bar NOT Suitable:**
âŒ **Ammonia (R717)**: Corrosive
  â†’ Use **ATEX Metallic IR** (316L SS)

â€¢ Phase-down: HFC quota -79% by 2030
â€¢ Ban: HFC >2500 GWP in new equipment (2020)
â€¢ **CO2 (R744)**: GWP = **1** (natural)
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: âœ… Future-proof

**EN 378 (Refrigeration Safety):**
â€¢ CO2: A1 (low toxicity, non-flammable)
â€¢ High-pressure equipment: PED
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: CE, PED compliant

**ASHRAE 15:**
â€¢ CO2 safety: Asphyxiation risk
â€¢ Oil monitoring: Critical compressor protection
â€¢ **TK3+ 130bar**: Dual output (shutdown + monitoring)
